statements.name: PROC INBREED
statements.description: The INBREED procedure calculates the covariance or inbreeding coefficients for a pedigree. PROC INBREED is unique in that it handles very large populations. † The INBREED procedure has two modes of operation. One mode carries out analysis on the assumption that all the individuals belong to the same generation. The other mode divides the population into nonoverlapping generations and analyzes each generation separately, assuming that the parents of individuals in the current generation are defined in the previous generation. † PROC INBREED also computes averages of the covariance or inbreeding coefficients within sex categories if the sex of individuals is known.

arguments.name: AVERAGE
arguments.description: Produces a table of averages of coefficients for each pedigree of offspring. The AVERAGE option is used together with the GENDER statement to average the inbreeding/covariance coefficients within sex categories.

arguments.name: COVAR
arguments.description: Specifies that all coefficients output consist of covariance coefficients rather than inbreeding coefficients.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: Names the SAS data set to be used by PROC INBREED. If you omit the DATA= option, the most recently created SAS data set is used.

arguments.name: INDL
arguments.description: Displays individuals’ coefficients for only the last generation of a multiparous population.

arguments.name: IND
arguments.description: Displays the individuals’ inbreeding coefficients (diagonal of the inbreeding coefficients matrix) for each pedigree of offspring. If you also specify the COVAR option, the individuals’ covariance coefficients (diagonal of the covariance coefficients matrix) are displayed.

arguments.name: INIT=
arguments.description: Specifies the covariance value cov if any of the parents are unknown; a value of 0 is assumed if you do not specify the INIT= option.

arguments.name: MATRIXL
arguments.description: Displays coefficients for only the last generation of a multiparous population.

arguments.name: MATRIX
arguments.description: Displays the inbreeding coefficient matrix for each pedigree of offspring. If you also specify the COVAR option, the covariance matrices are displayed instead of inbreeding coefficients matrices.

arguments.name: NOPRINT
arguments.description: Suppresses the display of all output.

arguments.name: OUTCOV=
arguments.description: Names an output data set to contain the inbreeding coefficients.

statements.name: BY
statements.description: You can specify a BY statement with PROC INBREED to obtain separate analyses on observations in groups defined by the BY variables. When a BY statement appears, the procedure expects the input data set to be sorted in order of the BY variables.

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: Specifies that the observations are sorted in descending order by the variable that immediately follows the word DESCENDING in the BY statement.

arguments.name: NOTSORTED
arguments.description: Specifies that observations are not necessarily sorted in alphabetic or numeric order.

statements.name: CLASS
statements.description: To analyze the population within nonoverlapping generations, you must specify the variable that identifies generations in a CLASS statement.

statements.name: GENDER
statements.description: The GENDER statement specifies a variable that indicates the sex of the individuals. Values of the sex variable must be character beginning with ‘M’ or ‘F’, for male or female.

statements.name: MATINGS
statements.description: You can specify the MATINGS statement with PROC INBREED to specify selected matings of individuals.

statements.name: VAR
statements.description: The VAR statement specifies three or four variables: the first variable contains an individual’s name, the second variable contains the name of the individual’s first parent, and the third variable contains the name of the individual’s second parent.
